However, historically, there have been various grassroots movements that have played a crucial role in bringing about peace treaties. For example, the peace agreement between Israel and Egypt was facilitated by grassroots movements that created public pressure for both countries' leaders to negotiate and reach a peaceful resolution. Similarly, the civil rights movement in the United States played a pivotal role in promoting racial equality and reducing violence, helping to bring about the Civil Rights Act in 1964. In general, grassroots movements can bring about social and political change by mobilizing citizens, creating public awareness of key issues, and pressuring policymakers to take action.
